title: Can I monetize other royalty free music on a YouTube channel? - Quora

response.answer_text: What do you mean by ‘other’? OK. I think that you mean; music tracks on YouTube library and music tracks on other websites… YouTube gives Royalty Free Music for YouTubers to use for their videos. You can find them on Creator Studio > Create > Audio Library. There are many beautiful music tracks on the other websites. But we cannot use most of them because of the copyright issues. However, there are many other NCS (No Copyright Sounds) on YouTube. You can search as ‘NCS’ on YouTube and find more beautiful and famous music tracks for your videos. They can be used in your videos and also you can monetize them without any copyright issue… If you have any questions, please ask… Thank You…

Yes you can use other royalty free music from other libraries but keep in mind that « royalty free music » doesn’t mean « free to use music », and most of the time you will need to buy a license. That said some libraries (including free music Archive, Music Screen..) offers free licenses for private use and for non commercial use.
